string-array.name: preventionList
string-array.item: Wash your hands regularly, with soap, throughout the day for about 20–30 seconds.
Make sure to wash your hands when coming from a public space, before eating, after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.
When unable to use water and soap, use hand sanitizer. The sanitizer must contain at least 60% alcohol.
Avoid contact with people who are sick.
Maintain a 1m distance when meeting someone.
Stay at home if you feel unwell
Use proper hygiene when coughing and sneezing. Blow into a tissue or into your elbow and dispose of your waste in the garbage right away.
Wear a facemask if you are sick or if taking care of people who are sick.
Disinfect items/surfaces you frequently use. Such as: phone, tablet, laptop, tv and ac remotes, light switches, door knobs, tables and countertops, toilets, faucets, and sinks.
